Description: Ceramic mould-made lamp with applied vertical band-handle. Discus decorated with five small rosettes round filling-hole. Shoulder decorated with crosses, palmettes, leaves. Raised, pointed oval base. Pinkish-brown, micaceous clay covered with a red slip. Burnt nozzle.
Curator's comments: Bibl. 'Liverpool AAA' xiv, 1927, p. 74; pl. lviii, 12.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (2229)
